author: RedacciÃ³n Deportes
title: Gustavo RamÃ­rez le hizo gol a Nacional en la final y saliÃ³ de inmediato al hospital; esta fue la razÃ³n - Semana
text: En la noche del pasado miÃ©rcoles 18 de diciembre, el Deportes Tolima fue local ante AtlÃ©tico Nacional en la gran final de la Liga BetPlay 2024-II. Un duelo intenso desde todo punto de vista jugado en el Manuel Murillo Toro, que dejÃ³ un resultado final del 1-1. Para el compromiso de vuelta, gracias a las anotaciones de Dairon Asprilla para los verdes y Gustavo AdriÃ¡n RamÃ­rez para los pijaos , la llave quedÃ³ abierta. Valga recordar que la vuelta se estarÃ¡ llevando a cabo el prÃ³ximo domingo 22, en el Atanasio Girardot de MedellÃ­n.Justo despuÃ©s del compromiso en la â€˜capital musicalâ€™ de Colombia, se conociÃ³ que el paraguayo RamÃ­rez, quien marcÃ³ el agÃ³nico tanto del empate para los locales al minuto 75, tuvo que salir de inmediato a uno de los hospitales de la ciudad.La razÃ³n: que buscaba hacerle compaÃ±Ã­a a su esposa tras el nacimiento de su hija. â€œLa figura de la noche se lleva a casa el premio mÃ¡s importante de su vida. Â¡Felicidades, Gustavo, por el gol y el nacimiento de Aitana!â€, celebraron las redes del cuadro vinotinto y oro.Al futbolista se le vio celebrar su tanto ante Nacional con una gran alegrÃ­a, ademÃ¡s de que puso el balÃ³n por debajo de su camiseta, justo en el estÃ³mago, e hizo el gesto con uno de sus dedos de estar bebiendo de un biberÃ³n.En los comentarios de la foto difundida por el cuadro tolimense, los seguidores del equipo le demostraron el cariÃ±o al jugador guaranÃ­ por haber logrado marcar y celebrar por partida doble al convertirse en papÃ¡. â€œDe marcar un gol en una final a un momento que recordarÃ¡ para toda su vida... quÃ© pedazo de noche, paraguayoâ€, dijo uno.Otro, algo mÃ¡s arriesgado, hizo una premoniciÃ³n del juego de vuelta: â€œEste paraguayo nos va a dar el tÃ­tulo en el Ãºltimo minuto... se le notan las ganas y el cariÃ±o por el equipoâ€. â€œEl que siempre entiende lo que se estÃ¡ jugando. Felicitaciones, paraguayo queridoâ€ , sumÃ³ otro mÃ¡s resaltando la labor de RamÃ­rez.El protagonista de la noche en IbaguÃ© fue elegido como la figura del partido y, posteriormente, hablÃ³ ante los medios de comunicaciÃ³n. â€œNo era el resultado que querÃ­amos, tenemos que buscar el tÃ­tulo allÃ¡â€, iniciÃ³. DespuÃ©s, se mostrÃ³ satisfecho: â€œla conexiÃ³n que tengo con la gente es muy buenaâ€. Lo que lo hacÃ­a mantenerse â€œcontentoâ€ de cara al siguiente mano a mano con Nacional. â€œVamos a prepararnos estos dÃ­as para llegar bienâ€, sumÃ³, demostrando que Tolima sigue buscando dar el batacazo. AdemÃ¡s, reclamo por la manera en que jugÃ³ el rival: â€œAl Deportes Tolima no hay que darle por muerto. Se demostrÃ³ cuando hacen tiempoâ€.â€œAcÃ¡ las piernas tiene que andar, la cabeza. Tenemos hambre de buscar el tÃ­tulo que merece la gente, y nosotros tambiÃ©nâ€ , finalizÃ³ con deseos absolutos de bordar la estrella para Tolima.David GonzÃ¡lez, tÃ©cnico al servicio de Tolima, analizÃ³ en rueda de prensa asÃ­ la llave: â€œEs una serie de 180 minutos, en los 90 minutos que corresponden en casa uno quiere sacar diferencia y de visitante sacar un resultado como el de hoy, lo normal es pensar que estÃ¡n mÃ¡s cerca del objetivoâ€.â€œObvio, querÃ­amos sacar la diferencia hoy, pero de la manera en que el equipo juega y hemos ido a cualquier cancha del paÃ­s a imponer condiciones, esta vez no serÃ¡ la excepciÃ³n. SerÃ¡ un bonito duelo entre equipos que juegan bien y vamos a ir a pelear hasta el Ãºltimo minutoâ€, finalizÃ³ de cara al juego decisivo del domingo.

author: Cynthia Measom
title: 3 Hidden Costs of Booking Flights Last Minute - And How To Avoid Them - NewsBreak
text:
By Cynthia Measom ,
7 hours ago Â©iStock.com Snagging a last-minute flight when you need it might seem like a relief but it can also sting if you end up paying more than youâ€™d like.
Learn More: 10 Airline Rewards Programs That Provide the Most Value for Your Points
Find Out: 3 Things You Must Do When Your Savings Reach $50,000
â€œBooking last-minute travel deals can sometimes allow travelers to save on airfare, however, there might also be some hidden costs that not many people know about,â€ said Mercedes Zach, travel expert at ASAP Tickets , part of Trevolution Group.
Hereâ€™s Zachâ€™s advice regarding unexpected costs of booking last-minute flights and how to avoid them .
Trending Now: Suze Orman's Secret to a Wealthy Retirement--Have You Made This Money Move?
Airlines Adjust Seat Prices Based On Demand â€œWhen it comes to popular destinations and specific dates with high demand, airlines typically adjust seat prices based on that demand,â€ said Zach. â€œAs the flight departure time approaches , the remaining seats become more valuable to the airline, and they know that those who need to take the flight will be willing to pay for their seat regardless of its price.â€
Zach explained that while last-minute flights generally tend to be pricier than those booked ahead, there are still some options for cutting costs.
â€œBecause airfares often fluctuate, itâ€™s worth monitoring your route and comparing prices with several different travel agencies, airlines and search engines to find the best deals that match the needs of your itinerary,â€ she said. â€œIf a direct flight is too expensive, consider connecting flights and secondary airports. You may even combine multiple airlines or different modes of transportation to get to your destination.â€
Read Next: 10 Best Money-Saving Travel Apps To Download in 2025
Zach also said that the more flexible you are, the better deals you can snag.
â€œAccording to industry insights, Sundays, Tuesdays and Wednesdays are typically the best days to book flights, as that saves you about 5-10% on domestic flights and up to 15% on international flights compared to other days of the week,â€ she explained. â€œSunday, however, is not the best day for flying, as lots of people are aiming to fly out or go back home for the start of the week. And with increased ticket purchases and flights happening on Fridays, it is considered the worst day for booking flights.
â€œRemember that early-morning or late-night flights may also be more affordable, as those are less convenient for most air travelers .â€
Additional Fees Can Apply for Selected Seating â€œIn addition,â€ said Zach, â€œlast-minute flight bookings often leave passengers with fewer available seating options, which can lead to additional fees for selected seating.â€
Zach recommends opting for a seat with no additional charges to avoid those fees. Lifehacker notes that itâ€™s not obvious to consumers that they donâ€™t have to pay a seat selection fee when booking, but it is possible, according to USA Today . Simply skip the seat selection screen and the airline will assign you a seat.
Checked Bag and Carry-On Fees Are More Expensive Zach said that checked bag and carry-on luggage fees also become more expensive closer to the departure date.
â€œItâ€™s worth keeping in mind that these fees are even higher if you pay for your checked luggage at the airport check-in desk ,â€ she added.
Zach recommended packing light and only traveling with a carry-on bag to avoid checked baggage fees .
â€œSome airlines do offer bundled deals that include seat selection and baggage fees at a discounted rate when booked at the last minute, but I wouldnâ€™t rely on that,â€ she said. â€œAnd if youâ€™re a frequent flyer, you can also consider using your miles and credit card points to cover some of the additional last-minute booking fees.
â€œMany air carriers also have rewards programs and limited-time member promotions that offer discounted fares, upgrades and other in-flight perks.â€
This article originally appeared on GOBankingRates.com : 3 Hidden Costs of Booking Flights Last Minute â€” And How To Avoid Them

author: Ramsey Pfeffinger
title: Boeing factory workers will go on strike after Thursday vote | FOX 13 Seattle
text: Boeing factory workers have officially voted down the latest contract terms, meaning they will go on strike for the first time in 16 years.Starting at midnight, 33,000 Boeing machinists and factory workers will stop work and factories will grind to a halt. Rippling effects will be felt not only here in Washington, but all over the country.On Thursday night, cheers erupted at IAM District 751 Union Hall in Seattle as the deal was voted down by 94.6% of voting workers.According to an analysis by investment bank TD Cowen, a 50-day strike could cost Boeing up to $3.5 billion in cash flow.The union workers have been negotiating with Boeing on a number of pay and workplace conditions.This is the first time they have gone on strike since 2008. That strike cost Boeing an estimated $100 million per day, according to a Reuters report. author: Travis Cummings
title: Stray Rescue saves animals from extreme winter weather | ksdk.com
text: ST. LOUIS â€” Calls rang in and drop-offs were around the clock at [Stray Rescue of St. Louis ](https://www.strayrescue.org/)as the extreme weather made its way into the St. Louis Metro on Friday. Extreme winter weather is never ideal for pets and animal rescue centers have scrambled to bring those without homes to shelter. Stray Rescue on Olive Boulevard is already inundated with animals from their normal intake so the influx of incoming dogs will challenge the space even more. Donna Lochmann, a rescuer, stocked up her truck with snacks, dry and wet food, leashes, and kennels for when calls came in. She has been involved with the center for 25 years. "It's a love-hate relationship. You know. You hate to see the animals out in this kind of weather but love the fact that we try to help and do all we can for each and every animal," Lochmann said. Lochmann had rescued a group of dogs in an abandoned house, a pregnant dog, and found one hiding in a cat house. "We definitely see more pity mixed with our organization and they're definitely a shorthaired animal so they can't withstand this. Dr. Edie Oliver, a veterinarian at Stray Rescue, explained what happens when animals are impacted by inclement weather. "When temperatures get below zero, dogs can get frostbite in just 30 minutes. Low blood sugar. Low blood pressure. Another one people don't often think about is dehydration, their water freezes so they don't have food and water," Oliver said. Intake levels are already challenging Oliver and her team. "Often we don't have space so we have puppies and adults just kind of everywhere we can put them," Oliver said as dogs packed the surgery room. "Even if it's garage, a shed, something like that. If you absolutely can't, they need some form of house, straw, a blanket, to make sure that they stay dry." she said. â€œIf you've got a spot on your couch or in your bed, or just inside. Absolutely. We need your help,â€ Lochmann added. The center has more than 400 dogs in foster care currently that need permanent homes.
